channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2533] 1925's vision of 1950's America [PIC]
[+1396] Dear Slinky - The Oatmeal
item.description: A letter from the Oatmeal to the Slinky.

item.title: [+1360] 7 Items That Tell People You're A Douche
item.description: We’re not supposed to judge a book by its cover, but humans aren’t perfect and it’s only natural for us to judge based on first impressions.

item.title: [+1123] Apple Engineer Told Jobs iPhone Antenna Would Cut Calls!
item.description: A carrier partner also raised concerns about the antenna before the device’s June 24 release, according to another person familiar with the situation.

item.title: [+1070] BREAKING: BP says no more oil going into Gulf
item.description: BP says oil has stopped leaking into the Gulf for the first time since April.

item.title: [+940] Tiger Camouflaged in Tall Grass. Beautiful... (pic)
[+921] Easy Rider
item.description: Here's Powerpig's latest pic, which was well over a year in the making, Enjoy!

item.title: [+822] Wed at 14, 'adulterous' girl, awaits stoning in Iran
item.description: She was only 14 when she was forced into marriage with an older man. Within a year of her wedding, Azar Bagheri was charged with adultery and sentenced to be stoned to death. In the past 4 years she has been on death row waiting to reach maturity so she could be put to death. She had been subjected to two mock stonings in this time.

item.title: [+800] Maslow's Hierarchy of Internet Needs (IMAGE)
item.description: Maslow's classic hierarchy of needs has now been updated and adapted for the Internet age.

item.title: [+767] Argentina Passes Gay Marriage Bill | News
item.description: With a 33-27 vote in the senate, Argentina becomes the first country in South America to legalize same-sex marriage. More and more countries are living up to "equal rights for all."

item.title: [+751] 18th-Century Ship Found at World Trade Center Site
item.description: By Wednesday, the outlines made it plain: a 30-foot length of a wood-hulled vessel had been discovered about 20 to 30 feet below street level on the World Trade Center site, the first such large-scale archaeological find since 1982, when an 18th-century cargo ship came to light at 175 Water Street.

item.title: [+740] 2.5 Million Muslims Threaten to Quit Facebook on July 21
item.description: Most of the fans are allegedly planning to quite Facebook on 21st of July if their demands are not met and join, what looks like a Facebook knockoff, Madina.com, made for a Muslim community.

item.title: [+678] Don't Want to Drink Straight Out of the Bottle? (PIC)
[+634] A look at New York City from the air [AERIAL PICS]
item.description: The Empire State Building stands in this aerial photograph taken over New York. Office and residential buildings stand in the financial district of Manhattan in this aerial photograph taken over New York, U.S., on Wednesday, July 7, 2010. Photographer: Daniel Acker/BloombergPHOTOS LARGE FORMAT 950px × 1425px

item.title: [+557] 5 Horrifying Things You Didn't Know About the Vagina
item.description: The first time you actually encounter a vagina in real life, it can throw you for a loop. There's all kinds of neat stuff goin' on down there!

item.title: [+553] Ryan Reynolds Dons the Green Lantern Uniform (PIC)
item.description: Those who don't know anything about the Green Lantern mythos like to say that Hal Jordan (and the other members of the Corps) are lame superheroes simply because all they do is wear a ring.

item.title: [+532] The World's Wildest Water Slides [Gallery]
item.description: This summer, make your way to one of these 10 water slides and revel in one of humankind's most entertaining inventions.

item.title: [+521] If Movie Titles Were Honest
item.description: Movie titles don't tell you much. If all you had to go on was the name, you might think Indiana Jones and the Raiders of the Lost Ark was a blacksploitation sequel, American Graffiti was Exit Through the Gift Shop, and Exit Through the Gift Shop was a porn they had to shoot when the Radison Inn double booked.

item.title: [+509] Oops, Sorry We Jailed You for Sexual Assault!
item.description: A 19 year-old deaf prisoner in Texas was arrested in 1991 for "stealing quarters from a soda machine." Then, they booked him for sexual assault. Turns out they might have been wrong.

item.title: [+489] Recession Is Not Over Yet, Americans Say
item.description: More than 70% of Americans think that the country is still in a recession, according to a new Bloomberg survey. Only 17% of those surveyed believe they are better off now than when President Obama took office.
